is.erle.mavlink

Class IsErleMavlinkActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • interactivespaces.activity.impl.ActivitySupport
      • interactivespaces.activity.impl.BaseActivity
        • interactivespaces.activity.impl.ros.BaseRosActivity
          • interactivespaces.activity.impl.ros.BaseRoutableRosActivity
            • is.erle.mavlink.IsErleMavlinkActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    interactivespaces.activity.Activity, interactivespaces.activity.ActivityControl, interactivespaces.activity.ros.RosActivity, interactivespaces.activity.SupportedActivity

    public class IsErleMavlinkActivity
extends interactivespaces.activity.impl.ros.BaseRoutableRosActivity
    This class performs all the tasks of processing message from the drone and translating it so that it is understood by other systems. It also receives commands from other activities, translates them into drone understandable bytes and then send it to the communication activity to be sent to the drone.

    This activity subscribes to 3 channels, one from waypoint processor activity, one from captain activity and one from comms activity. It will take the waypoint payload data and make it Mavlink(Drone) understandable. It will then publish this data on comms. It will also be subscribing comms, it will parse all the data into releavant fields and then publish it on relevant topics. The incoming data will have imu, compass, gps, battery, barometer etc data, it will all get separated and published on individual topics. It will receive commands from the captain activity and then process it and send it to the drone.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Abhay Kumar

      • publishers

        private static java.lang.String[] publishers
        The topic names for publishing data.

        PUBLISHER MAPPING

        publishers[0] -> outputCOM_M

        Topic Name : comms/input

        Usage : Send output to the comms activity

        publishers[1] -> outputWP_M

        Topic Name : waypoint/input

        Usage : Send output to the waypoint generator activity

        publishers[2] -> outputGeneral_M

        Topic Name : mavlink/output

        Usage : A General output topic having all the logs of mavlink activity

        publishers[3] -> captain

        Topic Name : captain/input

        Usage : Send output to the captain activity

        publishers[4] -> heartbeat

        Topic Name : mavlink/heartbeat

        Usage : An output topic having all the heartbeat messages

        publishers[5] -> hud

        Topic Name : mavlink/hud

        Usage : An output topic having all the HUD (Head Up Display) messages

        publishers[6] -> attitude

        Topic Name : mavlink/attitude

        Usage : An output topic having all the attitude messages

        publishers[7] -> status

        Topic Name : mavlink/system/status

        Usage : An output topic having all the system status messages

        publishers[8] -> time

        Topic Name : mavlink/system/time

        Usage : An output topic having all the system time messages

        publishers[9] -> gps

        Topic Name : mavlink/sensors/gps

        Usage : An output topic having all the GPS sensor messages

        publishers[10] -> imu

        Topic Name : mavlink/sensors/imu

        Usage : An output topic having all the IMU sensor messages

        publishers[11] -> scaled_pressure

        Topic Name : mavlink/sensors/pressure

        Usage : An output topic having all the scaled Pressure sensor messages

        publishers[12] -> global_position

        Topic Name : mavlink/position/global

        Usage : An output topic having all the Global Position messages

        publishers[13] -> local_position

        Topic Name : mavlink/position/local

        Usage : An output topic having all the Local Position messages

        publishers[14] -> servo_output

        Topic Name : mavlink/servoOutput

        Usage : An output topic having all the servo/BLDC motor output messages

        publishers[15] -> rc_input

        Topic Name : mavlink/rcInput

        Usage : An output topic having all the RC transmitter input messages

        publishers[16] -> current_mission_seq

        Topic Name : mavlink/current_mission_seq

        Usage : An output topic having all the Current Mission Sequence number messages

        publishers[17] -> nav_controller_output

        Topic Name : mavlink/controller/nav

        Usage : An output topic having all the Current Mission Sequence number messages

        publishers[18] -> terrain_report

        Topic Name : mavlink/terrainReport

        Usage : An output topic having all the Terrain Report messages

      • subscribers

        private static java.lang.String[] subscribers
        The topic names for subscribing data.

        SUBSCRIBER MAPPING

        subscribers[0] -> inputCOM_M

        Topic Name : comms/output

        Usage : Receive data from comms activity ie from drone

        subscribers[1] -> inputWP_M

        Topic Name : waypoint/output

        Usage : Receive data from waypoint generator activity about the waypoints

        subscribers[2] -> captain

        Topic Name : captain/output

        Usage : Receive command from the captain activity

        subscribers[3] -> rc_output

        Topic Name : captain/rc_output

        Usage : Receive RC output from the captain activity

      • mavPacket

        private com.MAVLink.MAVLinkPacket mavPacket
        A message to pack and unpack all messages to/from payload

        Common interface for all MAVLink Messages

        Packet Anatomy

        This is the anatomy of one packet. It is inspired by the CAN and SAE AS-4 standards.

        Byte Index Content Value Explanation

        0 Packet start sign v1.0: 0xFE Indicates the start of a new packet. (v0.9: 0x55)

        1 Payload length 0 - 255 Indicates length of the following payload.

        2 Packet sequence 0 - 255 Each component counts up his send sequence. Allows to detect packet loss

        3 System ID 1 - 255 ID of the SENDING system. Allows to differentiate different MAVs on the same network.

        4 Component ID 0 - 255 ID of the SENDING component. Allows to differentiate different components of the same system, e.g. the IMU and the autopilot.

        5 Message ID 0 - 255 ID of the message - the id defines what the payload means and how it should be correctly decoded.

        6 to (n+6) Payload 0 - 255 Data of the message, depends on the message id.

        (n+7)to(n+8) Checksum (low byte, high byte) ITU X.25/SAE AS-4 hash, excluding packet start sign, so bytes 1..(n+6) Note: The checksum also includes MAVLINK_CRC_EXTRA (Number computed from message fields. Protects the packet from decoding a different version of the same packet but with different variables).

        The checksum is the same as used in ITU X.25 and SAE AS-4 standards (CRC-16-CCITT), documented in SAE AS5669A. Please see the MAVLink source code for a documented C-implementation of it. LINK TO CHECKSUM

        The minimum packet length is 8 bytes for acknowledgement packets without payload

        The maximum packet length is 263 bytes for full payload

      • mavParser

        private com.MAVLink.Parser mavParser
        This is an instance of Parser class which has a convenience function called mavlink_parse_char which handles the complete MAVLink parsing. This function will parse one byte at a time and return the complete packet once it could be successfully decoded. Checksum and other failures will be silently ignored.

      • mavMessage

        private com.MAVLink.Messages.MAVLinkMessage mavMessage
        This is an instance of MAVLinkMessage which wraps up all the message classes sent by the drone.

      • targetSystem

        private static byte targetSystem
        This is the default id of the target system. It essentially is the first id which the mavlink activity sees

      • targetComponent

        private static byte targetComponent
        This is the default id of the target component. It essentially is the heartbeat component id which is 0. This can be used to send data globally to a target system

      • heartbeatReceiveFlag

        private static boolean heartbeatReceiveFlag
        A flag to show if any heartbeat message has been received. This signifies that atleast one drone is connected and data can be sent to it.

      • readWaypointList

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> readWaypointList
        A List of String arrays containing waypoint data read from the drone

        DATA MAPPING FOR STRING ARRAY

        Index 0 -> INDEX

        Index 1 -> CURRENT WP

        Index 2 -> COORD FRAME

        Index 3 -> COMMAND

        Index 4 -> PARAM1

        Index 5 -> PARAM2

        Index 6 -> PARAM3

        Index 7 -> PARAM4

        Index 8 -> PARAM5/X/LONGITUDE

        Index 9 -> PARAM6/Y/LATITUDE

        Index 10 -> PARAM7/Z/ALTITUDE

        Index 11 -> AUTOCONTINUE

      • readWaypointCount

        private short readWaypointCount
        A waypoint count message to store a count message received after the waypoint request list. Used to indicate termination of a waypoint request list message and also receive these many mission item messages.

      • missionCurrentSeq

        private short missionCurrentSeq
        The current sequence number of mission item being requested/sent. Used for termination/retry of sending all the mission items.

      • allowedArea

        private MinMaxPair<Point3D> allowedArea
        A min max pair of Point3D type to store the safety allowed area. The minimum value denotes the bottom south west corner and the maximum value is the point diagonally opposite to it. Thus, the safety allowed area is the volume inside the box.

      • allowedAreaFrame

        private byte allowedAreaFrame
        Frame of reference of the safety allowed area min max pair.

      • globalGpsOrigin

        private Point3D globalGpsOrigin
        Stores Global GPS Origin. Useful for terminating/retrying setGlobalGpsOrigin.

      • inputFile

        private java.io.File inputFile
        Stores the Parameter.xml file. This file contains the allowed commands and values of all the commands.

      • dataXML

        private XMLParamParser dataXML
        Stores an object of XMLParamParser class which helps in parsing and requesting limits of certain commands/messages.

      • logEntry

        private java.util.List<com.MAVLink.common.msg_log_entry> logEntry
        Stores the log Entry found on the remote drone.

      • sendMissionListStart

        private boolean sendMissionListStart(byte tSystem,
                                     byte tComponent)
        It sends a START message to the waypoint activity, denoting the start of a send mission sequence.it also sets the global tempTSystem and tempTComponent with the values asked by the user. It waits for the mission acknowledgement message from the drone, it it returns success then true is returned.
        Parameters:
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone.
        Returns:
        true if sending of the mission send list command is successful; false otherwise.

      • readMissionListStart

        private boolean readMissionListStart()
        Function overload for readMissionListStart(byte, byte). Calls readMissionListStart(byte, byte) with targetSystem and targetComponent
        Returns:
        true if the sending of the mission request list command is successful; false otherwise and even timeout.

      • readMissionListStart

        private boolean readMissionListStart(byte tSystem,
                                     byte tComponent)
        It sends a request list command to the drone to read all the mission file on the drone. It then waits for the drone to send a waypoint count message by checking for readWaypointCount value. If it is not -1 then some waypoint count message has been received. If it doesn't receieve the message it will retry for three times after which it will timeout and return a false.
        Parameters:
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone.
        Returns:
        true if the sending of the mission request list command is successful; false otherwise and even timeout.

      • setMissionCount

        Function overload for setMissionCount(short, byte, byte). Calls setMissionCount(short, byte, byte) with targetSystem and targetComponent
        Parameters:
        count - Number of waypoint data stored on the drone.
        Returns:
        true if the sending of the waypoint request command is successful; false otherwise and even timeout.

      • setMissionCount

        private boolean setMissionCount(short count,
                                byte tSystem,
                                byte tComponent)
        It sets the value of readWaypointCount with that received from the drone. It sends a mission request command to the drone to read the zeroth waypoint data on the drone. It then waits for the drone to send a mission item message after which it return true, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        count - Number of waypoint data stored on the drone.
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone.
        Returns:
        true if the sending of the waypoint request command is successful; false otherwise and even timeout.

        Returns:

      • sendWPRequest

        private boolean sendWPRequest(short i,
                              byte tSystem,
                              byte tComponent)
        It sends a waypoint request to the drone for ith waypoint data. It then checks whether a waypoint dat ahas been received or not by checking the size of readWaypointList. If it increased by one, that means a waypoint data has been received and then it returns a true value, otherwise it return false.
        Parameters:
        i - Request this waypoint data from the drone.
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone.
        Returns:
        true if the sending of the waypoint request command is successful and the activity receives a valid waypoint message; false otherwise and even timeout.

                              byte tSystem,
                              byte tComponent)

        Parameters:

      • doARM

        private boolean doARM(boolean armit,
                      byte tSystem,
                      byte tComponent)
        It arms/disarms the drone. It calls a doCommand function with MAV_CMD.MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM. Be careful with this function, it can arm/disarm without any safety checks meaning the drone can get disarmed in air too!
        Parameters:
        armit - True for arming the drone, false for disarming the drone.
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone
        Returns:
        It checks for the isCommandSent value and if it is equal to false, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

                               byte tComponent)
        It reboots the entire system. WARNING - Never call this function when the drone is in air. It calls the doCommand(short, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, byte, byte) function with a MAV_CMD.MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN option and other parameters as specified in its comments.
        Parameters:
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone
        Returns:
        It checks for the isCommandSent value and if it is equal to false, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

      • doSystemShutdown

        private boolean doSystemShutdown()
        It shuts down the entire system. WARNING - Never call this function when the drone is in air. Function overload for doSystemShutdown(byte, byte) . Calls doSystemShutdown(byte, byte) with targetSystem and targetComponent
        Returns:
        It checks for the isCommandSent value and if it is equal to false, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

        private boolean setMode(java.lang.String mode)
        It sets the flight mode of the default drone. Function overload for setMode(String, byte) . Calls setMode(String, byte) with targetSystem.
        Parameters:
        mode - Flight mode to be set on the drone.
        Returns:
        It checks for the isCommandSent value and if it is equal to false, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

      • setMode

        private boolean setMode(java.lang.String mode,
                        byte tSystem)
        It sets the flight mode of the target drone. It first looks for the numerical mapping value of the flight mode specified in the Parameter.xml file. After that it sends a set mode command to the target system for which it receives an acknowledgement.
        Parameters:
        mode - Flight mode to be set on the drone.
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        Returns:
        It checks for the isCommandSent value and if it is equal to false, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

      • saveAllowedArea

        private void saveAllowedArea(com.MAVLink.common.msg_safety_allowed_area allowed)
        Saves the allowed area message in allowedArea.
        Parameters:
        allowed - Allowed area message from the drone.

      • setAllowedArea

        private boolean setAllowedArea(Point3D minLatLongAlt,
                               Point3D maxLatLongAlt,
                               byte frame)
        Sets the allowed area of the drone. Function overload for setAllowedArea(Point3D, Point3D, byte, byte, byte) . Calls setAllowedArea(Point3D, Point3D, byte, byte, byte) with targetSystem and targetComponent
        Parameters:
        minLatLongAlt - South West Front Corner of the box you want to limit your drone to.
        maxLatLongAlt - North East Back Corner of the box you want to limit your drone to.
        frame - Frame of reference of the above coordinates.
        Returns:
        It compares the allowedArea value with the input values and if they are equal, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

      • setAllowedArea

        private boolean setAllowedArea(Point3D minLatLongAlt,
                               Point3D maxLatLongAlt,
                               byte frame,
                               byte tSystem,
                               byte tComponent)
        Sets the allowed area of the drone. It sends a safety set allowed area message to the drone with two diagonally opposite corners of a box the drone is supposed to fly in.
        Parameters:
        minLatLongAlt - South West Front Corner of the box you want to limit your drone to.
        maxLatLongAlt - North East Back Corner of the box you want to limit your drone to.
        frame - Frame of reference of the above coordinates.
        tSystem - Target system of the drone.
        tComponent - Target Component on the drone.
        Returns:
        It compares the allowedArea value with the input values and if they are equal, it returns a true, otherwise it times out after 3 retries and returns false.

                                   byte tSystem)

        tSystem - Target system of the drone.

                          int rate)

        Parameters:

        rate - requeste rate of the stream.
        Returns:
